title: Meaning of the $$n$$
text: The $$n$$ denotes the amount of components that the coefficient vector a of f(x) should have.

title: Meaning of $$x_1$$ , $$x_2$$ ,..., $$x_n$$
text: The underscores of the $$x$$ denote the different components of $$x$$, which are multiplied by the coefficient vector by the dot product.

title: Dot Product
text: The dot product multiplies the corresponding components of the two vectors and adds them all together.

title: Value of Coefficient Vector
text: The components of the coefficient vector a correspond to the coefficients of the $$x$$ components. For example, the first component of the coefficient vector is equal to the coefficient of $$x_1$$.
